title: Calder Vale Walks

images.title: The stone bridge in Calder Vale by Raymond Knapman, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The stone bridge in Calder Vale

images.title: Bob Jenkins / Three Men Not In A Boat
images.caption: Three Men Not In A Boat. The fishermen are actually on a wooden stage, on the small reservoir used to supply water for the Calder Vale Mill.

images.title: Sheep pasture near St Johns Church by Karl and Ali, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sheep pasture near St Johns Church

images.title: Bob Jenkins / Path Through the Bluebells
images.caption: Path Through the Bluebells. Walkers have carefully kept to the narrow, steep path and avoided too much damage to this Springtime display. The poppies appear to have been deliberately introduced.

images.title: Weir on the River Calder by Philip Platt, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Weir on the River Calder

images.title: St. John's at Calder Vale by Raymond Knapman, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St. John's at Calder Vale

images.title: David Medcalf, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lappet Mill, Calder Vale

images.title: Calder Vale by Ian Taylor, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Countryside to the south

description: This peaceful little village is located in a lovely spot on the edge of the Forest of Bowland AONB. It's a picturesque place with pretty cottages, a pond and Lappet Mill, an old cotton weaving mill which is still in use. This little circular walk starts in the village car park and takes you north to the mill pond and the 19th century St John's Church. On the way there's bluebell woods, a mill pond weir and views of the River Calder which runs through the area. There are also some pleasant footpaths through the countryside to the east of the settlement. To continue your walking in the area head north to one of the local area highlights at Nicky Nook . It's a lovely place with fine views and several pretty reservoirs to enjoy.
